ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 316
ygData.msgSnippet: Was just in guildchat there... apparently the Catapult is JUST in the game in order to make an affordable skill increase in Tinkering. Nice thought, but having
ygData.messageBody:
Was just in guildchat there... apparently the Catapult is JUST in the game
in order to make an affordable skill increase in Tinkering. Nice thought,
but having a useless item is, in the words of a fellow BB tinkerer
(Dumpton), "lazy and ridiculous".

Let's hope these rumours are unfounded.

Jokah Maybeakeg <Drunken Bandits>
Gnome Rogue of Bristlebane
Bristlebane Server




>From: Quasinom de Plume <eqmailing@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com
>To: EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com
>Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 316
>Date: Tue, 19 Sep 2000 10:49:07 -0700 (PDT)
>
>I was able to sell the gloves back to the vendor for just over 38pp (119
>cha) making the true cost per attempt only 3pp, assuming no failures. I
>also sold a pair to a gnome for 60pp.
>

>Ilsik Haucil
>Mith Marr Server
>
>--- Gazamel Prime <gazamel@...> wrote: > 1 steel lined
>gloves.....26pp
> > 1 sprockets.............. 7pp
> > 1 gears.................. 7pp
> > 1 metal twine............ 1pp
> > 1 firewater.............. 1gp
> >
> > Looks to be about 41 plat per attempt, which is a TON
> > better than the 225 per attempt previously thought to
> > be the lowest needed to increase in skill past 104.
> > Too bad they trivialize at 122, I'm at 125, and I got
> > there solely on Aqualungs and Rebreathers 8(
> >
> > /sigh, looks like all the new tinkers will get to
> > advance to the low 120s for about 1/6 the cost that us
> > veteran tinkers paid. I'm happy that they've closed
> > the gap some, but I feel somewhat cheated in the deal.
> >
> >
> >
